intro: Zornia vichadana, commonly known as the Vichada zornia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Zornia vichadana plays a role in soil stabilization and serves as a food source for certain wildlife in its habitat.
